subject: Re: [junit] how to use ExceptionTestCase ?
msgSnippet: ... I don t think anyone uses ExceptionTestCase. Kent himself said that he regrets creating it. ... Don t use it. ... The FAQ answers the question, How do I
messageBody:
>So said Lucas on 2003-05-22 --------------------
>import junit.extensions.ExceptionTestCase;
>
>public class Exception1Test extends ExceptionTestCase {
>
> public Exception1Test(String arg0, Class ex) {
> super(arg0, ex);
> }
>
> public void testThis() throws Exception {
> assertTrue(true);
> // no exception by now, but should work anyway
> }
>}
>
>
>the above code gives the following error:
>
>junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Class exception.Exception1Test has no
>public constructor TestCase(String name)
>
>but this constructor seems to have been made private by ExceptionTestCase

I don't think anyone uses ExceptionTestCase. Kent himself said that he regrets creating it.

>1. I question the design of this - the error message is misleading

Don't use it.

>2. how to use properly ? (code snippet) (didn't find in FAQ)

The FAQ answers the question, "How do I test for an exception?"

Take care.
